dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 524 IH: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify that the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency does not have the authority to disapprove a permit after it has been issued by the Secretary of the Army under section 404 of such Act.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. McKinley (for himself, Mr. Rahall, Mr. Gibbs, Mrs. Capito, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Huelskamp, Mr. Griffith of Virginia, Mr. Duncan of South Carolina, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, Mr. Bucshon, and Mr. Kline) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify that the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency does not have the authority to disapprove a permit after it has been issued by the Secretary of the Army under section 404 of such Act.

section.header: Permits for dredged or fill material
section.text: Section 404(c) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1344(c)) is amended by striking The Administrator is authorized and inserting Until such time as the Secretary has issued a permit under this section, the Administrator is authorized.
